message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.CC, cs.CR

Reasoning: The paper discusses the simulation of communication and meaning processing using algorithms, which suggests a focus on computational methods and artificial intelligence. This aligns with the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the paper mentions the textual domain of scientific articles, which suggests a focus on natural language processing and computational linguistics, aligning with the sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the organization and self-organization of communication, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society). The use of mutual information to measure the imprint of meaning processing on the historical organization of uncertainty suggests a focus on information theory, which aligns with the sub-category of cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper discusses the theories of Giddens and Luhmann, which are relevant to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
